paper_metadata.title: Germline BRCA2 Truncating Mutation in Familial Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma: A Case Controlled Study in China
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper reports a novel BRCA2 splice variant c.426-2A>G identified in familial esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC) patients, detailing penetrance data and individual case information.

individual_records.phenotype_details: diagnosed with ESCC, underwent neoadjuvant chemoradiation and esophagectomy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband was a female diagnosed with ESCC at age 53 years.

individual_records.phenotype_details: diagnosed with ESCC, underwent neoadjuvant chemotherapy and esophagectomy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Six months after her diagnosis of ESCC, her sister was also diagnosed with ESCC with symptoms of dysphagia, at the age of 48 years old.

individual_records.phenotype_details: carried the mutation but not diagnosed with any cancers
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Screening of other family members revealed that other sisters were negative for this mutation while brothers carried the mutation.

individual_records.phenotype_details: carried the mutation but not diagnosed with any cancers
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Screening of other family members revealed that other sisters were negative for this mutation while brothers carried the mutation.

individual_records.phenotype_details: carried the mutation but not diagnosed with any cancers
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Screening of other family members revealed that other sisters were negative for this mutation while brothers carried the mutation.

functional_data.summary: The c.426-2A>G mutation leads to exon 5 skipping and a premature stop codon in exon 6, resulting in a truncated BRCA2 protein.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in the affected sisters.
variants.population_frequency: Not identified in 50 sporadic ESCC patients screened.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on familial segregation and functional impact.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation was confirmed to be novel and not found in healthy controls.
key_quotes: The splice variant mutation results in exon 5 skipping with a frame shift leading to a premature stop codon in exon 6 and truncation.
Screening of other family members revealed that other sisters were negative for this mutation while brothers carried the mutation.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
